| DrainsFrom = kidney Source = interlobar veins DrainsTo = inferior vena cava
| Artery = Renal artery MeshName = Renal+Veins MeshNumber = A07.231.908.752
}} The 'renal veins' are veins that drain the kidney. They connect the kidney to
the inferior vena cava. They carry the blood purified by the kidney.

It is usually singular to each kidney, except in the condition "multiple renal
veins".

It also divides into 2 divisions upon entering the kidney:

* the anterior branch which receives blood from the anterior portion of the
  kidney and,
* the posterior branch which receives blood from the posterior portion.

Often, each renal vein will have a branch that receives blood from the ureter.
